Title: the cognition regeneration

Leonard: We’re pinned down.
Sheldon, why are you jumping up and down?
Aw.
Doing it right now. Oh, they can’t. There’s an important Little League game tomorrow.
Mm, if it makes you feel better, you still dress like a child.
Hot dogs.
You’re gonna have to be more specific.
More.
Oh, the video game. Yeah, that was bad.
How is super-aging any different than, like, doing crossword puzzles?
I drive you to work every day, my brain must look like the Hulk.
Yeah, I guess.
Honestly? It’s a little strange having dinner with your ex-boyfriend, and it’s not like we have a lot to talk about.
It’ll be fine, let’s just go.
Aaargh.
Ha, I knew you weren’t asleep.
I have Sheldon, that keeps most people away.
Oh, I know what he’s saying, and he’s not, he’s not funny.
She’s doing amazing. She can actually make a side effect, like 10% chance of liver failure, sound like a 90% chance of liver success.
Yeah. Although, when he was trying to figure out the tip, I’m pretty sure I saw smoke coming out of his ears. You’re not really considering working for him, are you?
Don’t you think it might be a little weird to work for someone you used to date?
Yeah, it’s weird.
No, no, I’m not jealous, I just think you have got a good thing going where you are right now, and you make great money and you haven’t slept with any of your co-workers.
Uh.
Of course I don’t want you to be unhappy, but I also want you to be smart, and working for an ex-boyfriend isn’t very smart. You don’t have to stop, just slow down, I’ll jump out.
No, I told her she was being not smart. Which was dumb.
We covered this, I’m dumb.
So you think it’s fine if she works for Zack?
Yeah, but she also used to sleep with Zack.
Thank you.
So you think it’s okay?
Hi.
That doesn’t seem to be where I shine. How about I just give you one of these?
Yeah, sorry.
Well, thanks. And I don’t want you to be stuck at a job you don’t like.
Well, I don’t love it, but if you really want to take this job, I’ll find a way to deal with it.
No, no, no, no, you’re, you’re unhappy there and then you’re gonna blame me for making you stay, and it’s fine, I’ll just, I’ll suck it up.
Yeah, see, now I feel terrible, like I’m being selfish and holding you back. What? Say something. Yeah, that is pretty annoying.
Absolutely. I just want you to be happy. And maybe a little turned on about how selfless I’m being.
Not if I want to be doing this later.
Howard: We can’t get through.
Then use the shoot button, not the wonderful thing about Tiggers button.
Okay, challenge them again.
No wonder they beat us, they’re jocks.
Kids are always better at video games.
Oh, so our love is not real?
Now, this is rare. I don’t know which one of you I want to stop talking first.
Boy, it is neck and neck right now.
All right, this is everything. What do you want to learn?
Okay, well, how about, oh, I teach you some close-up magic.
Hey, the circus arts are very physically and mentally demanding. Have you ever tried to juggle?
And it’s hard, isn’t it? So the key is, the moment one ball is at the top of its arc, you toss the next one. Hmm?
Uh, hold on. There’s an old saying in juggling.
No, it’s if you want to have fun, start with one. Yours we think, but we do not say. All right, just toss it up and catch it a few times, get comfortable with it.
No.
So you told her she was being dumb?
I don’t know, maybe.
Yes, but that’s gonna be true of a lot of guys she works for.
Again.
You know what? I’m with Leonard, this isn’t cool.
I went to see your mom.
I just told you, your mom’s.
Well, since you find my magic tricks so embarrassing, I got to wondering what cool hobbies you had as a kid.
She didn’t say much of anything. But she said a lot. (Through ventriloquist’s doll) Hi, Bernadette, remember me?
I can’t believe you made fun of me all these years while you were a closeted ventriloquist.
Well, since you enjoyed getting rid of all my stuff, you know, maybe we should throw this little lady in the wood chipper.
Which is?
Tammy Jo St. Cloud. Oh, and I’m a dork for juggling.
All right, very funny.
That’s enough, put her away.
All right, you’re freaking me out.
Raj: Sheldon, get over here and help.
Well, I know how you feel. I tried one of those electronic Japanese toilets, practically shot myself across the room.
You know who’s a super-ager? Jennifer Lopez. Like, what is her secret?
If you really want to challenge yourself, you could learn to speak Hindi.
Could you say that in English? I actually, I never learned Hindi.
Okay. Shall we? Oh, my God. It’s light, it’s flaky, it’s buttery. You don’t need to have sex with him, just eat one of these.
You want a real challenge, try keeping me from eating more of these.
Damn it, he’s good at that, too.
Why did you even go to dinner with the guy?
Well, he is much more attractive than Leonard.
I disagree. Penny is a strong, independent woman. The more you try to control her, the more she’ll push back.
Oh, no, she’s gonna leave you for someone, might as well get it over with.
Sheldon: Okay, one second.
I’m trying to shoot.
What happened to me? I used to excel at these things.
Well, I don’t like it.
No, but it’s not just video games. I downloaded the new O.S. for my phone, took me a week to stop accidentally texting kissy faces to everyone.
I guess I just need to face it, I’m no longer a wunderkind. Now I just wonder what’s for lunch.
Yay.
I’ve been thinking about our recent humiliation.
At the hands of those teenagers.
Boy teenagers.
I started doing some reading on cognitive vitality, and I came across an area of research called super-aging.
The theory is that if you really tax your brain, the neurofibers will become thicker and the glial cells more lustrous.
Well, it’s not just doing simple cognitive tasks. You need to push your brain out of its comfort zone and reach mental exhaustion.
Jab mein aat saal ka tha maine seekha tha. (I did that when I was eight)
Hey.
Raj is teaching me to make croissants.
Yes. Yeah, it seemed daunting at first, but then I realized, it’s like the chemistry set I had as a kid. Only, when your brother eats this, no one has to call Poison Control.
Yes, it is delicious. Physicist, baker, lover, what can’t I do?
For the last time, I am not having a tickle fight with you.
You’re just using food to mask the fear that you’re fundamentally unlovable and therefore going to be alone forever.
It really doesn’t matter, as long as it’s challenging.
Howard, I’m trying to make myself uncomfortable, not everyone else.
Okay, I think I got that.
Okay. Just to be on the safe side, am I in any danger of getting juggler’s elbow?
Are you sure? ‘Cause I’m feeling a twinge.
Amy, look, I’m on a unicycle!
I hurt myself juggling.
Howard said I could borrow it, Bernadette said forever.
What, are you crazy? I’m on a unicycle.
Wait, I need help getting down.
Drag out our mattress and put it over here, then go across the hall, get their mattress and put it over here. But before you do any of that, scratch my nose.
I’m returning this stuff to Howard.
Oh, I stopped that, it was dumb. Uni, bi, tri, menstrual, all cycles are dumb.
Well, it is. If I wanted to hold three things at once, I’d wear cargo pants.
Are you calling me a quitter?
This conversation is over.
Thank you.
It’s okay, I stopped being upset about that. And no, the irony is not lost on me.
This article says the peak age for making a Nobel Prize-winning discovery is 40.
So I’m running out of time.
Oh, you have to say that, you’re sweet on me.
Hey, I thought you were sweet on me.
You’re so cute. I’m gonna go learn how to walk on stilts.
I’m doing it. I’m doing it. I’m tall and I’m doing it. (Waking up in bed) Ah, man.
Penny: I didn’t know you could drink while you’re breastfeeding.
Ooh. I’m gonna get another. You want food?
Oh, Zack. Hey.
Well, it’s a bar, so pretty good. Uh, what’s new?
Well, congratulations.
No, on, on getting engaged, good for you.
Yes, yes, he’s working for the government on an infinite persistence gyroscope. Of course, the first time I say it right, he’s not even here.
Uh, yeah, sure, I’ll check with Leonard.
Hey, you ready to go?
What’s the matter?
What? He loves you, okay? And he’s interested in your work. You could talk about the infinite perspective… I swear I know it.
Well, and his fiancée will be there, so you know, if the conversation lags, we can talk about their wedding.
Come on, I spent an entire plane ride with you talking about the trailer for Deadpool 2.
Hi. Hey, where’s your fiancée?
Oh, no, what happened?
Uh, it’s okay, I’m still in pharmaceutical sales.
Yeah, lying isn’t my favourite part of the job. Actually, I’m not crazy about a lot of it.
Oh, that’s a nice offer.
Right, ’cause it spells menu.
See, that wasn’t so bad. He even picked up the check.
Well, maybe, I mean, it seems kind of perfect. I have sales experience, and I’ve been a waitress, so I have restaurant experience, and if he’s figuring out my Christmas bonus, we could buy a boat.
You work with Sheldon, you tell me.
Okay, are you seriously jealous of me working with Zack?
Great, so you want me to stay at a job I’m not happy at?
You okay? You kind of look like Zack trying to figure out that tip.
So he’s my ex-boyfriend, who cares? I can’t believe Leonard would be so insecure.
And Zack’s engaged. Leonard has no reason to feel threatened.
What, you wouldn’t trust him?
Yeah, that, that is the sexiest dog.
‘Cause he’s scared of you?
Yeah.
Hey.
You want to talk?
Look, we can have a reasonable conversation and I won’t get mad. I don’t like it after sex, and I don’t like it now.
Yeah. All right, just come here. Look, I get me working with Zack is weird and I don’t want you to be uncomfortable.
Then what do we do?
No, I know you’ll try, but it’ll make you miserable, which will make me miserable, and I’m just gonna stay where I’m at for now.
You don’t need to do that, it’s okay.
Okay, are you sure about this?
Hey, uh, so I’ve been thinking about it and I want to take the job.
Oh, so there’s no job?
Okay, thanks anyway. Bye. Well, his fiancée thought the idea of us working together was stupid. You were right, I was wrong. Aren’t you gonna say anything?
Bernadette: Yeah, they say the yeast in beer helps with milk production.
Ruin it for me and I’ll break this glass over your head.
Yeah, breastfeeding burns, like, 5,000 calories a day. Do not touch that phone.
So you wanted to learn something physical and you came to Howard Wolowitz?
Yes, I’m juggling my love for you and my embarrassment of you right now.
Is it I’m going to die alone?
Really? I have no trouble believing that at all.
We’re talking about the same Leonard, right?
I would never let Howard work with an ex.
I wouldn’t trust her. He’s thin and sexy like a Jewish greyhound.
And I’d like to think Howie wouldn’t take a job I was uncomfortable with.
Terrified.
Hey, I didn’t know you were home. Where you been?
Seriously, where were you?
Why?
Oh. What’d she say?
First of all, that’s not what she sounds like, she’s from South Carolina.
Okay, it’s not like I wanted to be a ventriloquist. I was in beauty pageants and I needed a talent besides spreading rumours that the other contestants were pregnant.
No. And the little lady has a name.
Tammy Jo St. Cloud.
Sorry, you’re not a dork. (Through doll) You’re a clown. (Bernadette) Tammy Jo, don’t say that, you’ll make him feel bad. (Doll) Look at him, what reason he got to feel good?
Don’t listen to her, she’s been in a box for, like, 25 years. (Doll) Yeah, back when his haircut was fashionable.
Amy: I’m pretty sure that’s a myth, let me check.
To denial.
Hey.
What smells so good?
Is this part of your super-aging?
Well, clearly mental tasks are not enough. Maybe you need to challenge your motor skills.
How did you get from croissants to a unicycle?
Where did you get it?
Have you tried letting go of the rope?
All right, well, have fun.
Well, what do you want me to do?
What are you doing?
Oh. Well, Bernadette made me promise if you didn’t want it, we’d give it to a homeless clown. What happened to learning the unicycle?
You said juggling was dumb, too.
Sheldon, is it possible that when things get really difficult, you just give up?
Well, if you honestly…
His mother warned me. Everybody warned me. Actually, he warned me.
I made you tea.
I’m sorry I called you a quitter.
What are you reading?
So?
That’s ridiculous, you’re a brilliant man. The best years of your life are still ahead of you.
Well, if you’re really worried about your career, maybe you should consider spending a little less time with video games and comic books.

Okay, fine, let’s say you never win a Nobel Prize. Let’s say you spend your life doing solid scientific research surrounded by friends and loved ones who appreciate you, not for what you’ve accomplished but for who you are as a man. Wouldn’t that be a life well-lived?
So many warnings.
Zack: What are the odds of running into you here?
Oh, tons of stuff. Put artificial grass in my backyard, got engaged, had a scary mole that turned out to be Sharpie.
Oh, thanks. How about you? Hey, how’s Leonard? Is he still smart?
I love that little guy. Hey, we should all have dinner sometime.
Cool, I’ll check with Sara. Sara, pull up my calendar. It never works for me.
Oh, she couldn’t make it. She had an emergency.
Thanks. Wow, working on a top secret government project, that is so cool. Do you have a bodyguard to keep spies away?
I miss that guy. He’s like the Swedish Chef Muppet. I don’t know what he’s saying, but he’s funny.
So, Penny, what’s going on with you? How’s the job?

Hey, if you’re not happy there, I’ve been looking for a new head of sales at my company. And we don’t sell drugs, just menus, so the only lie you’ll be telling is we print on recycled paper. We don’t.
You know, we’d make a great team. Or as we say in the menu business, I can’t do this without Me N U.
Yeah, right? It’s funny. I got a lot of menu jokes, but that’s my favourite.
Oh, bad news. When my fiancée found out that I was offering a job to my ex-girlfriend, she said it was a stupid idea and threw a shoe at me.
Nope, just a little bump on my forehead.
Bernadette (as Doll): Oh, big daddy, I don’t think so. You marry Miss Bernie, you marry me. We all family now.
Don’t be that way. If you don’t mind a few splinters, we can have us a ménage à trois. Ooh.

If you really want to challenge yourself, you could learn to speak Hindi.

I have Sheldon, that keeps most people away.
I miss that guy. He’s like the Swedish Chef Muppet. I don’t know what he’s saying, but he’s funny.
Oh, I know what he’s saying, and he’s not, he’s not funny.

Uh, it’s okay, I’m still in pharmaceutical sales.
She’s doing amazing. She can actually make a side effect, like 10% chance of liver failure, sound like a 90% chance of liver success.
Yeah, lying isn’t my favourite part of the job. Actually, I’m not crazy about a lot of it.

It really doesn’t matter, as long as it’s challenging.
Okay, well, how about, oh, I teach you some close-up magic.
Howard, I’m trying to make myself uncomfortable, not everyone else.
So you wanted to learn something physical and you came to Howard Wolowitz?
Hey, the circus arts are very physically and mentally demanding. Have you ever tried to juggle?
Yes, I’m juggling my love for you and my embarrassment of you right now.
And it’s hard, isn’t it? So the key is, the moment one ball is at the top of its arc, you toss the next one. Hmm?
Okay, I think I got that.
Uh, hold on. There’s an old saying in juggling.
Is it I’m going to die alone?
No, it’s if you want to have fun, start with one. Yours we think, but we do not say. All right, just toss it up and catch it a few times, get comfortable with it.
Okay. Just to be on the safe side, am I in any danger of getting juggler’s elbow?
Are you sure? ‘Cause I’m feeling a twinge.
See, that wasn’t so bad. He even picked up the check.
Yeah. Although, when he was trying to figure out the tip, I’m pretty sure I saw smoke coming out of his ears. You’re not really considering working for him, are you?
Well, maybe, I mean, it seems kind of perfect. I have sales experience, and I’ve been a waitress, so I have restaurant experience, and if he’s figuring out my Christmas bonus, we could buy a boat.
Don’t you think it might be a little weird to work for someone you used to date?
You work with Sheldon, you tell me.
Okay, are you seriously jealous of me working with Zack?
No, no, I’m not jealous, I just think you have got a good thing going where you are right now, and you make great money and you haven’t slept with any of your co-workers.
Great, so you want me to stay at a job I’m not happy at?
You okay? You kind of look like Zack trying to figure out that tip.
Of course I don’t want you to be unhappy, but I also want you to be smart, and working for an ex-boyfriend isn’t very smart. You don’t have to stop, just slow down, I’ll jump out.
Amy, look, I’m on a unicycle!
How did you get from croissants to a unicycle?
Howard said I could borrow it, Bernadette said forever.
Have you tried letting go of the rope?
What, are you crazy? I’m on a unicycle.
Wait, I need help getting down.
Well, what do you want me to do?
Drag out our mattress and put it over here, then go across the hall, get their mattress and put it over here. But before you do any of that, scratch my nose.
So you told her she was being dumb?
No, I told her she was being not smart. Which was dumb.
Why did you even go to dinner with the guy?
So he’s my ex-boyfriend, who cares? I can’t believe Leonard would be so insecure.
Really? I have no trouble believing that at all.
And Zack’s engaged. Leonard has no reason to feel threatened.
We’re talking about the same Leonard, right?
So you think it’s fine if she works for Zack?
Well, he is much more attractive than Leonard.
Yes, but that’s gonna be true of a lot of guys she works for.
Yeah, but she also used to sleep with Zack.
I would never let Howard work with an ex.

Yeah, that, that is the sexiest dog.

Oh, no, she’s gonna leave you for someone, might as well get it over with.
I’m returning this stuff to Howard.

Oh, I stopped that, it was dumb. Uni, bi, tri, menstrual, all cycles are dumb.
You said juggling was dumb, too.
Well, it is. If I wanted to hold three things at once, I’d wear cargo pants.
Sheldon, is it possible that when things get really difficult, you just give up?
Are you calling me a quitter?
His mother warned me. Everybody warned me. Actually, he warned me.
That doesn’t seem to be where I shine. How about I just give you one of these?
Look, we can have a reasonable conversation and I won’t get mad. I don’t like it after sex, and I don’t like it now.
Yeah. All right, just come here. Look, I get me working with Zack is weird and I don’t want you to be uncomfortable.
Well, thanks. And I don’t want you to be stuck at a job you don’t like.
Well, I don’t love it, but if you really want to take this job, I’ll find a way to deal with it.
No, I know you’ll try, but it’ll make you miserable, which will make me miserable, and I’m just gonna stay where I’m at for now.
No, no, no, no, you’re, you’re unhappy there and then you’re gonna blame me for making you stay, and it’s fine, I’ll just, I’ll suck it up.
You don’t need to do that, it’s okay.
Yeah, see, now I feel terrible, like I’m being selfish and holding you back. What? Say something. Yeah, that is pretty annoying.
I’m sorry I called you a quitter.
It’s okay, I stopped being upset about that. And no, the irony is not lost on me.
This article says the peak age for making a Nobel Prize-winning discovery is 40.
So I’m running out of time.
That’s ridiculous, you’re a brilliant man. The best years of your life are still ahead of you.
Oh, you have to say that, you’re sweet on me.
Well, if you’re really worried about your career, maybe you should consider spending a little less time with video games and comic books.
Hey, I thought you were sweet on me.

You’re so cute. I’m gonna go learn how to walk on stilts.
Okay, are you sure about this?
Absolutely. I just want you to be happy. And maybe a little turned on about how selfless I’m being.
Hey, uh, so I’ve been thinking about it and I want to take the job.

Nope, just a little bump on my forehead.
Okay, thanks anyway. Bye. Well, his fiancée thought the idea of us working together was stupid. You were right, I was wrong. Aren’t you gonna say anything?
Not if I want to be doing this later.
Hey, I didn’t know you were home. Where you been?
I went to see your mom.
I just told you, your mom’s.
Well, since you find my magic tricks so embarrassing, I got to wondering what cool hobbies you had as a kid.
She didn’t say much of anything. But she said a lot. (Through ventriloquist’s doll) Hi, Bernadette, remember me?
First of all, that’s not what she sounds like, she’s from South Carolina.
I can’t believe you made fun of me all these years while you were a closeted ventriloquist.
Okay, it’s not like I wanted to be a ventriloquist. I was in beauty pageants and I needed a talent besides spreading rumours that the other contestants were pregnant.
Well, since you enjoyed getting rid of all my stuff, you know, maybe we should throw this little lady in the wood chipper.
No. And the little lady has a name.
Tammy Jo St. Cloud. Oh, and I’m a dork for juggling.
Sorry, you’re not a dork. (Through doll) You’re a clown. (Bernadette) Tammy Jo, don’t say that, you’ll make him feel bad. (Doll) Look at him, what reason he got to feel good?
